pullRequest.body:
This PR defines the functor `GradedObject.single : C ‚•§ GradedObject J C` which sends an object `X : C` to the graded object which is `X` in degree `j` and the initial object of `C` in other degrees.

This shall be used in the construction of the unit of the tensor product on `I`-graded objects (when `I` is an additive monoid).

---

LGTM except for the missing docstring.
bors d+

LGTM except for the missing docstring.
bors d+
How would you feel about making `C` explicit in this definition? This would make it consistent with `Functor.const`, for example.
Actually, the target category `C` is implicit in `Functor.const`. I have followed the same design here: in `(single j).obj X`, the category `C` can be inferred from the type of `X`.
Sorry, you're right. For some reason I thought the roles of `J` and `C` were swapped in this case, but that's not true.

Not sure if it's useful, but you could package your results in a natural isomorphism
```lean
noncomputable def singleCompEval (j : J) : single j ‚ãô eval j ‚âÖ ùü≠ C :=
  NatIso.ofComponents (singleObjApplyIso j) (by aesop_cat)
```
Thanks for the suggestion! I have added this.
